trans-unit.source: Please answer the following questions about the community in which you live.
trans-unit.target: Kindly answer the following questions about the community you dey live inside.

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, are there sidewalks or walking paths?
trans-unit.target: In your area, abi there sidewalks or walking paths dey?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, is there a park or playground?
trans-unit.target: For your neighborhood, er park or playground dey inside?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, is there a community center or recreation center where families get together?
trans-unit.target: In your area, abi there a community center or recreation center where ebi socialization station?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, is there a library or other place to get free books?
trans-unit.target: In your area, be there library or place weh dem give books for free?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, is there litter or garbage on the street or sidewalk?
trans-unit.target: In your area, litter or garbage dey for street or sidewalk itop?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood is there poorly kept or rundown housing?
trans-unit.target: In your place, some of the houses dem no dey in good condition?

trans-unit.source: In your neighborhood, is there vandalism such as broken windows or graffiti?
trans-unit.target: For your place, dem dey vandalize things like dem break windows or put graffiti?

trans-unit.source: To what extent do you agree with these statements about your neighborhood or community?
trans-unit.target: To which level you kind of dey agree with these things wey you hear about your neighborhood or town?
Absolutely Agree
More or less Agree
More or less Disagree
Absolutely Disagree

trans-unit.source: People in your neighborhood help each other out.
trans-unit.target: The people for your place dey like help each other.

trans-unit.source: People in your neighborhood watch out for each other's children.
trans-unit.target: The people for your area dey watch out for each other their children.

trans-unit.source: Your child is safe in your neighborhood.
trans-unit.target: Your child dey safe for your place.

trans-unit.source: When you encounter difficulties, you know where to go for help in your community.
trans-unit.target: When you face challenges, you know the nose tap wey you go poke for help from the society.

trans-unit.source: Your child is safe at school.
trans-unit.target: Your child dey safe for school.

trans-unit.source: These are statements people have made about their food situation. For these statements, please mark whether the statement was often true, sometimes true, or never true for your household in the <b>last 12 months</b>.
trans-unit.target: These things be what dem say about their food place. For these things, mark if dem always true, sometimes true, or never true for your household within <b>last 12 months</b>.

trans-unit.source: The food that we bought just didn't last, and we didn't have enough money to get more.
trans-unit.target: The food wey we buy no just last, and we no get enough money to buy more.
Not true at all
Sometimes true
Many times true

trans-unit.source: We couldn't afford to eat balanced meals.
trans-unit.target: We no fit afford balanced meals.

trans-unit.source: In the <b>last 12 months</b>, did you or other adults in your household ever cut the size of your meals or skip meals because there wasn't enough money for food?
trans-unit.target: Over the <b>last 12 months</b>, you or the adults for your area ever cut the size of your meals or jump meals because food money no dey?

trans-unit.source: If yes, how often did this happen - almost every month, some months but not every month, or in only 1 or 2 months?
trans-unit.target: If yes, how often e happen - almost every month, some months but not every month, or only 1 or 2 months?
Almost every month

trans-unit.source: Some months but not every month
trans-unit.target: Some months but not every month
Only 1 or 2 months

trans-unit.source: Below are statements about the environment in your home. Please indicate how much you agree that the statement is true of your home.
trans-unit.target: Below be things for your house wey make am up. Kindly show how you dey feel about them.

trans-unit.source: We are usually able to stay on top of things.
trans-unit.target: Usually, we dey keep things on check.
Definitely False
Somewhat Untrue
Somewhat True
Truly True

trans-unit.source: You can't hear yourself think in our home.
trans-unit.target: For our house, e be noise-oh, you can't hear yourself think so.

trans-unit.source: The atmosphere in our home is calm.
trans-unit.target: Our house dey calm.

trans-unit.source: We have a regular morning routine at home.
trans-unit.target: Our morning routine dey alright for house.

trans-unit.source: How well do you think you are handling the day-to-day demands of raising children?
trans-unit.target: How better you dey manage the daily demands of parenting children?
Not good one bit

trans-unit.source: Over the <b>last two weeks</b>, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
trans-unit.target: In the <b>last two weeks</b>, how frequent have the following things disturb you?
Few days

trans-unit.source: More than half of the days
trans-unit.target: More than half of the days
Every blessed day

trans-unit.source: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
trans-unit.target: Feeling nervous, anxious, or like something bad go pop

trans-unit.source: Not being able to stop or control worrying
trans-unit.target: Unable to control or stop worrying
Feeling like this depression dey make every corner dark

trans-unit.source: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
trans-unit.target: Little interest or joy dey things you used to love

trans-unit.source: We are interested in how you feel about the following statements. Read each statement carefully. Indicate how you feel about each statement.
trans-unit.target: Make we see how you feel about the following words. Review each of the words with care, and tell your own feelings toward them.
Truly Disagree
Disagree
Barely Disagree
Agree so far
Strong Agree
Even more Strongly Agree

trans-unit.source: There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) who is around when I am in need.
trans-unit.target: Got a special someone (spouse, buddy, etc.) when you dey in need?

trans-unit.source: There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) with whom I can share joys and sorrows.
trans-unit.target: Someone special dey in your corner where you fit share laughter and tears?

trans-unit.source: My family really tries to help me.
trans-unit.target: Your family too dey help.

trans-unit.source: I get the emotional help & support I need from my family.
trans-unit.target: The kind of emotional support you dey seek from your family fr get.

trans-unit.source: I have a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) who is a real source of comfort to me.
trans-unit.target: Di someone special (spouse or partner as example), ebi comfort station for you?

trans-unit.source: My friends really try to help me.
trans-unit.target: Di people you call fren, them too dey support.

trans-unit.source: I can count on my friends when things go wrong.
trans-unit.target: You fit depend on your friends when things go sideways.

trans-unit.source: I can talk about my problems with my family.
trans-unit.target: Your family and you dey come to terms, and talk about problems.

trans-unit.source: I have friends with whom I can share my joys and sorrows.
trans-unit.target: You also have friends with ample ear for thrills and grief.

trans-unit.source: There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) in my life who cares about my feelings.
trans-unit.target: Some special individual for your life dey give emotional assurance.

trans-unit.source: My family is willing to help me make decisions.
trans-unit.target: Make your family or family members decision position they dey control.

trans-unit.source: I can talk about my problems with my friends.
trans-unit.target: For problems wey you get, you fit share them within your friend circle.

trans-unit.source: In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to you?
trans-unit.target: In your everyday life, on how many occasions have dey things come for you?
Below the once-a-year marker
Some earrings every year
Few baskets monthly
Weekly occurrences
Close to everyday

trans-unit.source: You are treated with less courtesy or respect than other people.
trans-unit.target: You dey treated with less regard nor respect compared to the next naas.

trans-unit.source: You receive poorer service than other people at restaurants or stores.
trans-unit.target: Receive worse kind of service within joints and shops.

trans-unit.source: People act as if they think you are not smart.
trans-unit.target: People to believe say you no know book.

trans-unit.source: People act as if they are afraid of you.
trans-unit.target: Dem relate with you like predator they fear.
You dey threatened or dey thrown into harassing situations.

trans-unit.source: Please select Yes or No to indicate whether each event has happened to you <b>in the past year</b>.
trans-unit.target: Do indicate through Yes or No whether each thing relate to your list of events for <b>last year</b>.
Health:

trans-unit.source: An injury or illness which kept you in bed a week or more, or sent you to the hospital.
trans-unit.target: A serious injury or accident that kept you resorting to bed for over a week or eventually hospital bound.

trans-unit.source: An injury or illness which was less serious than above but still sent you to the doctor or kept you in bed for a day or two.
trans-unit.target: A less serious matter than an injury or sickness, but one that sent you to the er or stood you two days or less in bed.
Major dental work done.
Significant changes in eating habits made.
Changes in sleep patterns or sleep habits engaged.

trans-unit.source: Major change in your usual type and/or amount of recreation.
trans-unit.target: Recreational activities dey change type and/or amount noticeably.
Work:

trans-unit.source: Change to a new type of work.
trans-unit.target: Transition into a fresh line of work.

trans-unit.source: Change in your work hours or conditions.
trans-unit.target: Shift in hours or changes for your current work environment.

trans-unit.source: Change in your responsibilities at work (more responsibilities).
trans-unit.target: At work, acquirement of more responsibility given.

trans-unit.source: Change in your responsibilities at work (fewer responsibilities).
trans-unit.target: Lower job responsibilities now.

trans-unit.source: Change in your responsibilities at work (promotion).
trans-unit.target: Responsibilities at work shot up 'cause of promotion.

trans-unit.source: Change in your responsibilities at work (demotion).
trans-unit.target: Responsibilities at work curved low by demotion.

trans-unit.source: Change in your responsibilities at work (transfer).
trans-unit.target: Relocation at job resulted in transfer.
They dey give you stress at work, like your supervisor dey power.
Work ran into issues, den no like the organization nor amongst co-workers.

trans-unit.source: Troubles at work (with persons under your supervision).
trans-unit.target: Person or people wey you dey manage for work dey trouble you.
Some other issues wey sprout towards work.
Business took sharp turn.
Retire time.

trans-unit.source: Loss of a job (laid off from work).
trans-unit.target: No work, job dey loose with layoff.

trans-unit.source: Loss of a job (fired from work).
trans-unit.target: Job removal, redundancy mix-up.

trans-unit.source: Taking a course to help you with your work.
trans-unit.target: Take up a course, grow business wares.
Home and Family:
Big time change for living quarters.

trans-unit.source: Change in residence (move within the same town or city).
trans-unit.target: House displacement (move still dey within same local).

trans-unit.source: Change in residence (move to a different town, city, or state).
trans-unit.target: House shift (went to another city, town, state even).
Family reunion season change.

trans-unit.source: Major change in health or behavior of family member.
trans-unit.target: Family member dey trouble with health matters.
Marriage chapter started.
Expecting baby.

trans-unit.source: Gain of a new family member (birth of a child).
trans-unit.target: One more baby for family a fresh-born baby.

trans-unit.source: Gain of a new family member (adoption of a child).
trans-unit.target: Added extension for new member, adopted one.

trans-unit.source: Gain of a new family member (a relative moving in with you).
trans-unit.target: Added extension for family, kinsman shifting in.
Life starts with spouse work restarting or ending.
The child head out (went to learn or hull for college indeed).
The child head some married, however married.
When child went for an excursion, to sum up all.
Spouses exchanged tempers.
In-law movie.

trans-unit.source: Change to the marital status of your parents (divorce).
trans-unit.target: Status of parents got altered, the nuptial pull down.

trans-unit.source: Change to the marital status of your parents (remarriage).
trans-unit.target: Status of parents got altered, re-nuptial promises accepted.
Partner part time separated, often work issue.

trans-unit.source: Separation from spouse (due to marital problems).
trans-unit.target: Partner part time separated, marriage faced issues.
Divorce case settled.
Grandchild was born.
Partner dey meet heavenly line.
Extended family child resting beyond-life doubt.

trans-unit.source: Death of other family member (brother or sister).
trans-unit.target: Extended family jnr. or sister pa happened to be stopped.
Father go into shadow & quiet city.
Personal and Social:
Habitual mutation.

trans-unit.source: Beginning or ending school or college.
trans-unit.target: A plan concerning academic enrollment or de-enrollment.
Institutes and lab benches adjusted generally.
Political legacy altered.
Faithful eye different order now.
For socialization, whole the activities dey change.
Taking time relax, a retreat.
Relationships become marvel.
Decide getting married.
Companion crisis day.

trans-unit.source: "Falling out" of a close personal relationship.
trans-unit.target: Personal ties powed.
Incident with severity.
Minor law infringement.
Paid bid farewell to a friend's company.

trans-unit.source: Major decision regarding your immediate future.
trans-unit.target: Outcome came from immediate life plans.
Personal success chapter.
Finance:
Finance balloon, net income dey swell.
Finance go thin since earnings lower.

trans-unit.source: Major change in finances (investment and/or credit difficulties).
trans-unit.target: Too many challenges for saving or investing issues.

trans-unit.source: Loss or damage of personal property.
trans-unit.target: When possessions dey losses or seem messed up.
Small scale buy.
Big change purchase.

trans-unit.source: Foreclosure on a mortgage or loan.
trans-unit.target: Loss of regular inflow as mortgage got exploded.

trans-unit.source: <b>Instructions:</b> Think of this line as representing where people stand in the <i>country where you live</i>. To the <b>right</b> are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respected jobs. To the <b>left</b> are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, the least education, the least respected jobs, or no job. The further to the right you are on the line, the closer you are to the people at the very top; the further to the left you are, the closer you are to the people at the very bottom.<br><b>Where would you place yourself on this line?</b><br>Move the slider to where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your country.
trans-unit.target: <b>Instructions:</b> You for picture that line as show wey people dey stand for the <i>country weh you live</i>. On the <b>right</b> dey people who dey feel themselves the most most cash, most degree, job wey dey respect pass. Na the ones wey dey the <b>left</b> that dey struggle pass least cash, least learning, no job. If you go further right on the line, you go close to top dogs; you go further left, you dey nears the bottom ones.<br><b>Which location you go rate yourself?</b><br>Make slide like the position wey you dey feel yourself at this place in living as one compared to others for your nation.

trans-unit.source: <b>Instructions:</b> Think of this line as representing where people stand in their <i>communities</i>. People define community in different ways; please define it in whatever way is most meaningful to you. To the <b>right</b> are people who have the highest standing in their community. To the <b>left</b> are the people who have the lowest standing in their community.<br><b>Where would you place yourself on this line?</b><br>Move the slider to where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your community.
trans-unit.target: <b>Instructions:</b> This line dey represent where people relate to in their <i>communities</i>. People see community in different scopes; use any that strike real to you. On the <b>right</b> dey people with high regard in community. On the <b>left</b> dey people wey low rate in community.<br><b>Which location you fit place yourself now?</b><br>Use slider to place where you stand at this moment in this world as relative to different heads for your place.
